text: The 2003 Australian Carrera Cup Championship was a CAMS sanctioned national motor racing championship Sporting Regulations for the 2003 Australian Carrera Cup Championship Retrieved from cams.com.au via replay.waybackmachine.org/ on 1 April 2011 open to Porsche 911 GT3 Cup Type 996 cars complying with Australian Carrera Cup regulations.Technical Regulations for the 2003 Australian Carrera Cup Championship Retrieved from cams.com.au via replay.waybackmachine.org/ on 1 April 2011 The championship, which was administered by CupCar Australia Pty Ltd, was the inaugural Australian Carrera Cup Championship.Records, Titles and Awards, 2006 CAMS Manual of Motor Sport, page 14-10 ==Calendar== The championship was contested over a nine-round series with three races per round. {| class="wikitable" generated with :de:Wikipedia:Helferlein/VBA-Macro for EXCEL tableconversion V1.7<\hiddentext> style="font-size: 85%" |- ! align="center" | Rnd ! Circuit 2003 Race Results Archive Retrieved from www.natsoft.biz on 1 April 2011 ! State ! Date |- ! 1 | Phillip Island Grand Prix Circuit | Phillip Island, Victoria | 11–13 April |- ! 2 | Eastern Creek International Raceway | Sydney, New South Wales | 2–4 May |- ! 3 | Winton Motor Raceway | Benalla, Victoria | 23–25 May |- ! 4 | Hidden Valley Raceway | Darwin, Northern Territory | 27–29 June |- ! 5 | Queensland Raceway, Ipswich | Ipswich, Queensland | 18–20 July |- ! 6 | Sandown Raceway | Melbourne, Victoria | 12–14 September |- ! 7 | Mount Panorama Circuit, Bathurst | Bathurst, New South Wales | 10–12 October |- ! 8 | Surfers Paradise Street Circuit | Surfers Paradise, Queensland | 24–26 October |- ! 9 | Eastern Creek International Raceway | Sydney, New South Wales | 28–30 November |} ==Points system== Championship points were awarded at each race on the following basis: {| class="wikitable" generated with :de:Wikipedia:Helferlein/VBA-Macro for EXCEL tableconversion V1.7<\hiddentext> style="font-size: 85%" |- | width="120" height="30" | Finishing Position | width="18" align="center" | 1st | width="22" align="center" | 2nd | width="20" align="center" | 3rd | width="19" align="center" | 4th | width="19" align="center" | 5th | width="19" align="center" | 6th | width="19" align="center" | 7th | width="19" align="center" | 8th | width="19" align="center" | 9th | width="24" align="center" | 10th | width="24" align="center" | 11th | width="24" align="center" | 12th | width="24" align="center" | 13th | width="24" align="center" | 14th | width="24" align="center" | 15th | width="24" align="center" | 16th | width="24" align="center" | 17th | width="24" align="center" | 18th | width="24" align="center" | 19th | width="24" align="center" | 20th | width="36" align="center" | 21st – last |- | height="30" | Points awarded | align="center" | 60 | align="center" | 54 | align="center" | 48 | align="center" | 42 | align="center" | 36 | align="center" | 30 | align="center" | 27 | align="center" | 24 | align="center" | 21 | align="center" | 18 | align="center" | 15 | align="center" | 12 | align="center" | 9 | align="center" | 6 | align="center" | 6 | align="center" | 3 | align="center" | 3 | align="center" | 3 | align="center" | 3 | align="center" | 3 | align="center" | 1 |} ==Championship results== {| class="wikitable" generated with :de:Wikipedia:Helferlein/VBA-Macro for EXCEL tableconversion V1.7<\hiddentext> style="font-size: 85%" |- !
